citation.article-title: Psychrobacter immobilis gen. nov., sp. nov.: genospecies composed of Gram-negative, aerobic, oxidase-positive coccobacilli.

p.s: Psychrobacter (Psy.chro'bac.ter. Gr. adj. psychros cold; M.L. masc. n. bacter rod; M.L. masc. n. Psychrobacter a rod that grows at low temperatures)

Strains are aerobic, gram-negative, nonmotile, nonpigmented, nonsporulating, catalasepositive, oxidase-positive, penicillin-susceptible coccobacilli that are 0.9 to 1.3 μm in diameter and 1.5 to 3.8 μm long.

Figure 1 illustrates the microscopic appearance of several strains, showing that the cocci tend to be oval shaped (Fig. 1B), whereas the rods can vary in length from extremely short (Fig. 1A) to relatively long (Fig. 1C and D).
For some strains the rods tend to be somewhat swollen (Fig. 1D).
Most strains are psychrotrophic; they are able to grow at 5°C and have temperature optima near 20"C, and they are generally unable to grow at 35 to 37°C.
Those strains able to grow well at 35 to 37°C usually cannot grow at 5°C.
Colonies on heart infusion agar are smooth and opaque.
